bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Blanca Malaret, November 21, 1941

div1.p: Hench sends Malaret copies of letters concerning the photostats he has requested of the Military Hospital No. 1 history. He also sends reprints of his yellow fever article and hopes that Cubans regard it as the beginning of Hench's campaign to credit Finlay's work among American physicians.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Blanca Malaret, November 21, 1941
div1.opener:
November 21, 1941
Miss Blanca Malaret
Secretary to Dr. Saladrigas
Finlay Institute
Havana, Cuba
My dear Miss Malaret:
div1.p:
Permit me to enclose carbons of letters I have
just sent to Dr. Perez and to the Alabama Photo Studios
regarding the photostatic copy of Galliol's History of
Military Hospital No. 1. I appreciate greatly your help in
this matter.

Permit me to send you two copies of my recently
published article on the Conquest of Yellow Fever. I hope
that you and my other Cuban friends will see in it at least
the first step in an attempt to bring to the attention of
American physicians the greatness of Dr. Finlay and his tre-
mendous contribution to the conquest of yellow fever. We
Americans don't know him well enough and in turn we would
like you to know Dr. Reed and his associated better also.
It delights me that I can work for a better understanding
between the Cuban and American medical professions.
I am sending Dr. Ramos a copy also.
div1.closer: With kindest regards, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
